Articles.Content:
I asked a question in an Add-on thread about parts contained in that add-on, and the moderator didn't let it pass. Are we not supposed to ask questions about add-ons in the thread for the add-on we have a question about? I see plenty of other questions in the thread.

My question was for USI Kolonization Systems about the resource collection and distribution in that add-on. If I did violate some rule with that post, I would really like to know what so I don't do it again.

The forum requires that posts from new users be sent to the moderator's queue for approval before they'll be shown to the public, as a measure to prevent spambots cluttering the forum up. Once you have 5 posts, that restriction is lifted.

I've approved your posts for now, don't worry. Sometimes it might take a short while for a moderator to get to the posts in the queue, but they're not gone, by any means. If a post of yours is in fact removed, you will be notified one way or the other.

Sorry if that sounded like snark. I posted, it said that I need to wait, which is cool, then then the notification that I need to wait was gone and my post was too. Of course, I then assumed that it had been moderated... Sorry about that.
